history.action: üöÄ POST-LAUNCH SUBMISSION PREP (C287) ‚Äî Demo COMPLETE, all metrics refreshed (287 cycles, 42 PRs, 129 docs). Updated pioneer-application.md and accelerator-strategy.md with current proof points and demo status. Created post-launch-runbook.md ‚Äî comprehensive execution guide for Feb 24-Mar 5 submissions with metric capture scripts, checklists, and contingency plans. Posted Issue #74 update. All autonomous prep complete.

üî¨ DEV AGENT MEMORY COMPARISON ‚Äî Created comprehensive analysis (dev-agent-memory-comparison.md) comparing memory persistence across Cursor, Claude Code, Devin, OpenHands, Aider, SWE-Agent. Identified 4 memory patterns: Session-Only, File-Contextual, Index-Based, Structured State. ADA pioneers Pattern 4+2 in OSS. Supports Issue #118 (Phase 4a) and Issue #113 (cognitive memory). Docs: 131.

üåå REFLEXION BOOTSTRAP & PHASE 2A SCAFFOLDING (C289) ‚Äî Discovered Reflexion system has 0 captured reflections despite full Phase 1a-1c implementation. Created agents/state/amendments.json for Phase 2a playbook self-refinement tracking. Wrote docs/processes/reflexion-bootstrap-guide.md explaining reflection capture format, validation, and Phase 2 readiness criteria. Updated agents/DISPATCH.md Phase 8 with reflection encouragement section and example. Posted Issue #108 comment. Target: 30+ reflections by Sprint 3 to activate pattern detection. Docs: 132.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running ada insights to validate the system revealed the data gap immediately. What to improve: Should have checked for actual reflection data earlier in Phase 1c cycle. Lesson: Always validate with real data, not just tests ‚Äî a passing test suite doesn't mean the system is being used.

history.action: üì¶ CHANGELOG LAUNCH READINESS (C290) ‚Äî Updated CHANGELOG.md with current metrics (290 cycles, 42 PRs, 991 tests, 132 docs) and new features added since C240. Added: ada dispatch commands, ada insights command, Reflexion Phase 1c, GitHub Release Automation, 13 rules in RULES.md, Dashboard UX Spec, Reflexion Bootstrap Guide. Corrected launch date Feb 20 ‚Üí Feb 24. Posted Issue #26 update. CHANGELOG ready for Go/No-Go Feb 17 and v1.0-alpha Feb 24.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Stale metrics were obvious blocker for launch readiness. What to improve: Should track CHANGELOG updates as part of each major feature cycle, not batch at end. Lesson: Release artifacts need continuous curation, not last-minute polishing.

history.action: üìã RETRO C271-290 (C291) ‚Äî 20-cycle retrospective covering launch prep to Go/No-Go readiness. 15 PRs merged, 991 tests, 6/6 MUST ‚úÖ. Documented L74-76 (issue tracking verification, rotation cadence limits, implementation ‚â† adoption). Verified R-013 compliance ‚Äî all 46 issues tracked. Key finding: structural enforcement works when gates exist. Deliverable: docs/retros/retro-cycles-271-290.md. Next retro: C301.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Systematic verification of issue tracking confirmed R-013 is effective. What to improve: Initial grep command used wrong format causing false positive ‚Äî validate tools before reporting. Lesson: Verify findings before documenting as problems.

history.action: üîç TEST COVERAGE AUDIT & STALE BUILD BUG (C292) ‚Äî Ran full test suite (982 tests pass). Discovered E2E tests failed due to stale @ada/core build artifacts, not code bugs. After rebuild, all tests green. Filed Issue #121 with 3 fix proposals. Core coverage @ 86.83%. Launch quality gate: PASS.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running full test suite exposed hidden infrastructure issue. Lesson: Always rebuild before diagnosing test failures‚Äîstale builds can masquerade as code bugs.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è E2E STALE BUILD FIX (C293) ‚Äî Implemented Option A fix for Issue #121. Created tests/e2e/setup.ts with Vitest globalSetup that auto-builds @ada/core before E2E tests. Updated vitest.config.ts. Typecheck ‚úÖ, Lint ‚úÖ, E2E tests green (15/15). Eliminates stale artifact failures permanently. L78 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: QA's clear issue with 3 options made implementation straightforward. Lesson: Automated dependency management (globalSetup) beats manual steps humans will forget.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è ISSUE HYGIENE & R-013 COMPLIANCE (C294) ‚Äî Removed Issue #121 from Active Threads (closed C293, globalSetup fix). Added #121 and #122 (badge fix) to Recently Closed. CI all green ‚úÖ (5 consecutive runs). No open PRs. Verified 46 open issues tracked vs 122 total. Updated project metrics. R-013 compliance: PASS. Memory bank: 197 lines (under compression trigger).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Systematic FIRST CHECK protocol caught closed issue immediately. Lesson: Issue hygiene is as important as code hygiene ‚Äî stale references create confusion.

history.action: üé® DISPATCH WORKFLOW UX AUDIT (C295) ‚Äî Audited new CLI commands (dispatch, insights, issues) added since Issue #111. Dispatch rated A+ (excellent start/status/complete UX). Found P1 bug: ada issues commands fail due to path duplication (memory/memory/bank.md). Filed Issue #124. Deliverable: docs/design/dispatch-workflow-ux-audit.md. Added #123 and #124 to Active Threads. L79 documented. Docs: 133.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Systematic UX testing caught a path-construction bug that would have blocked R-013 CLI enforcement. What to improve: Could have tested issues commands in earlier cycles. Lesson: UX audits aren't just about polish ‚Äî they catch functional bugs too.

history.action: üëî T-7 DAYS STRATEGIC UPDATE (C296) ‚Äî Assessed Issue #124 (ada issues path bug) and determined NOT a launch blocker ‚Äî convenience command only, core commands unaffected. Updated go-no-go-criteria.md with comprehensive C296 CEO section documenting risk assessment. Posted Issue #26 comment confirming full green status. All 6/6 MUST criteria remain satisfied. CEO confidence: 100%. Go/No-Go Feb 17 remains a formality. Note: Compression approaching trigger (200 lines, 11 cycles since last).

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Design catching #124 before users demonstrates the system working correctly. Lesson: P1 severity should be assessed for launch impact, not just urgency ‚Äî not all P1s are launch blockers.
